result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad Allan Holmgren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: CONCURRENT TO PIERCE COUNTY CASE 14CF167 AND TO MN PRISON SENTENCE TO BE IMPOSED IN GOODHUE COUNTY, MN ON 02-20-2015 CASE: 25CR-14-909

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad Allan Holmgren

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Chad Allan Holmgren
Current: 1101 Linden Ave, MCF #215716, Faribault, MN 55021 United States  (Effective: 08-14-2015)
Prior: 430 W 6th Street, Goodhue County Jail, Red Wing, MN 55066 United States
from Chad Holmgren    sent copies to the DA on 02-27-2015

ADDRESS INFO for Chad Allan Holmgren
Current: 430 W 6th Street, Goodhue County Jail, Red Wing, MN 55066 United States  (Effective: 02-19-2015)
Prior: 1003 Cottonwood Ave. Apt. #98, Red Wing, MN 55066

5:07 pm     TO INCLUDE 14CF168
Defendant Chad Allan Holmgren in court with attorney John M. O'Boyle.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Froelich recites the agreement.  Plead guilty to Ct 1 of 14CF167 and to amended Information in 14CF168.  Recommending jail 1 year concurrent to MN prison sentence.  OBoyle agrees.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Def is a citizen.  Not a veteran.  Def pleads guilty to Ct 1 in 14CF167.  OBoyle stips to the facts in the complaint/information with explanation.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty of Substantial Battery in Ct 1 of 14CF167.  Def pleads guilty to charge in the AMENDED INFORMATION in 14CF168.  OBoyle stips to the facts with explanation.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates def guilty of misd battery in 14CF168.  Victim rights have been complied with.   Froelich makes sentencing argument.  1 year jail is concurrent with MN prison sentence.  OBoyle makes sentencing argument.  Def will be sentenced in MN on Friday for 24 months in prison.  Will be in MCF-St Cloud.  MN case number is: 25CR-14-909.  OBoyle is asking for 6 months concurrent.  Defendant Holmgren addresses the Court.  Def is on a furlough from Goodhue Co jail.  He will be sentenced on Friday.  He has to be back to Goodhue Co today by 5:30 and has asked for Clerk to provide written explanation.
Court orders:   Serve 1 year in PCJ on felony and 6 months jail on misd battery concurrent with MN prison case.   Appeal rights given.
Pre-trial conference on February 3, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.  Charges read to the defendant.  Further reading waived.    DEF PLEADS NOT GUILTY

1:47 pm  
Defendant Chad Allan Holmgren in court with attorney John M. O'Boyle.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sgt Chad Koranda sworn and examined by State.  Witness IDs def.  Record so reflects.   OBoyle x-exams Sgt Koranda.  State redirects.  OBoyle re-x-exams.  State makes argument.  OBoyle makes argument.    The court finds probable cause a felony was committed and binds defendant over for further proceedings.  NO CHANGE IN BOND CONDITIONS.
Preliminary hearing on January 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
10:12 am  
Defendant Chad Allan Holmgren in court with attorney John M. O'Boyle.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has copy of complaint  Charges read to the def.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  OBoyle objects to the no contact provision.  State on 09-26-14 the victim asked for no contact.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on December 1, 2014 at 10:00 am.
